trans-unit.source: Abstract class that provides a property description to be used while writing to markup which encapsulates access to properties and their values.
A property is either represented as a string or a list of items.
If the property can be represented as a string, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.IsComposite%2A> is `false`.
If <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.IsComposite%2A> is `true`, the property is a list of items.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the attributes associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref>.
The collection of attributes.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> identifier for the markup property if the property is implemented as a dependency property
The default behavior returns `null`.
The dependency property identifier.
When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> is an attached <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The default behavior is to return `false`.

When IsAttached is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.DependencyProperty%2A> is not `null` and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.PropertyDescriptor%2A> can be `null`, but is not required to be.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property is an attached <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> is a composite property.
The default behavior is to return `false`.

If IsComposite is `false`, the property can be represented as a string and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.Value%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.StringValue%2A> are valid to use.
If IsComposite is `true`, the property is one or more items and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.Items%2A> is valid to use.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> is this property is a composite property; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> represents a constructor argument.
The default behavior is return `false`.

When IsConstructorArgument is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.PropertyDescriptor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.DependencyProperty%2A> are both `null`.
XAML only uses IsConstructorArgument for representing the constructor arguments of instances of <xref:System.Windows.Markup.MarkupExtension>.
See [Markup Extensions and WPF XAML](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this property represents a constructor argument; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> represents direct content of a collection.
The default behavior is to return `false`.

When IsContent is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.PropertyDescriptor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.DependencyProperty%2A> are both `null`.
Dictionaries are included when determining whether this <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty> represents direct content.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property represents direct content; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> represents the key used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupObject"></xref> to store the item in a dictionary.
The default behavior is to return `false`.
When IsKey is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.PropertyDescriptor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.DependencyProperty%2A> are `null`.
XAML will use the identified property as an `x:Key` attribute.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this property represents a key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> represents text which is passed to a type converter to create an instance of the property or if a constructor should be used.

The default behavior is to return `false.` When IsValueAsString is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.PropertyDescriptor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.DependencyProperty%2A> are both `null`.
If the property is provided through <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupObject.Properties%2A> and IsValueAsString is `true`, it will be the only property the type will provide.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, if this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> represents a string; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the items that make up the value of this property.
If the property is not an enumeration, only one item will be returned.
If the property is an enumeration, or enumerable, all the items will be returned.

At least one item is always returned, because <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupObject> will not create a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty> for properties with no items.
The items that make up the value of this property.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a name that is used for diagnostics and error reporting.
A serializer should not use this value.
It should use the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.PropertyDescriptor%2A> and/or <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty.DependencyProperty%2A> instead.
The identifier property name.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> for the markup property.
The default behavior returns `null`.
The property descriptor.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the CLR type of the property.
The CLR type.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the string value of this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref>.
The string value.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the set of types that this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref> will reference when it serializes its value as a string.
TypeReferences enables a serializer to ensure that the de-serializer has enough information to convert references to these type from the string representations.
The set of types.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the current value of this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupProperty"></xref>.
The current value.
